required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparing Brain Images Before and After MRI-upgrade - TimFit Upgrade Study
clinical_study.official_title: Brain Images Before and After Upgrade of the MRI-scanner (Siemens Tim TRIO vs Siemens PRISMA FIT) - The TimFit Study

brief_summary.textblock: In the Ghent University, an upgrade of the MRI-scanner used for research from Siemens Trio Tim to Siemens Prisma Fit is planned in the near future. As a change of MRI hard- and software might influence brain images, it is necessary to evaluate the images before and after the upgrade.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in grey matter volume before versus after MRI-upgrade
primary_outcome.time_frame: 7 months, 4 scan sessions of max 1 hour

primary_outcome.measure: Change in cerebral perfusion (ml/100g/min) using Arterial Spin Labeling before versus after MRI-upgrade
primary_outcome.time_frame: 7 months, 4 scan sessions of max 1 hour

primary_outcome.measure: Change in arterial transit times before versus after MRI-upgrade
primary_outcome.time_frame: 7 months, 4 scan sessions of max 1 hour

primary_outcome.measure: Change in functional connectivity (fc) using Resting State functional MRI before versus after MRI-upgrade
primary_outcome.time_frame: 7 months, 4 scan sessions of max 1 hour

primary_outcome.measure: Change in effective connectivity using resting state functional MRI before versus after MRI-upgrade
primary_outcome.time_frame: 7 months, 4 scan sessions of max 1 hour

primary_outcome.measure: Change in white matter diffusion before versus after MRI-upgrade
primary_outcome.time_frame: 7 months, 4 scan sessions of max 1 hour

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in image quality of FLAIR image before versus after MRI-upgrade
primary_outcome.time_frame: 7 months, 4 scan sessions of max 1 hour

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in image quality of SWI image before versus after MRI-upgrade
primary_outcome.time_frame: 7 months, 4 scan sessions of max 1 hour

arm_group.description: six healthy volunteers: 3 male (age 20-40; 40-60 and 60+) and 3 female (age 20-40; 40-60 and 60+)

intervention.description: Brain imaging using magnetic resonance imaging, using several MRI sequences: structural imaging (grey matter, using T1-imaging), cerebral perfusion using arterial spin labeling), functional and effective connectivity (using resting-state functional MRI), white matter tracts (using diffusion imaging), white matter lesions (using Fluid-attenuated inversion recovery MRI (FLAIR)) and microbleeds (using Susceptibility weighted imaging (SWI))

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteer
Exclusion Criteria:
- Protheses or artificial implants, no magnetic or metal parts in the body
- Being pregnant or breastfeeding
- Having claustrophobia
